head.citation-title: A Bloch-Landau theorem for slice regular functions
head.abstracts: © Springer-Verlag Italia 2013.The Bloch-Landau Theorem is one of the basic results in the geometric theory of holomorphic functions. It establishes that the image of the open unit disc ð”» under a holomorphic function f (such that f (0) = 0 and fʹ (0) = 1) always contains an open disc with radius larger than a universal constant. In this paper we prove a Bloch-Landau type Theorem for slice regular functions over the skew field ℍ of quaternions. If f is a regular function on the open unit ball ð”¹ ⊂ ℍ, then for every w ∈ B we define the regular translation fw of f. The peculiarities of the non commutative setting lead to the following statement: there exists a universal open set contained in the image of ð”¹ through some regular translation fw of any slice regular function f: ð”¹→ℍ (such that f (0) = 0 and ∂Cf (0) = 1). For technical reasons, we introduce a new norm on the space of regular functions on open balls centred at the origin, equivalent to the uniform norm, and we investigate its properties.

copyright.$: Copyright 2017 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
